channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Shovel-ready projects choice must consider environment - lawyers
item.description: Spending on infrastructure to boost the economy after Covid-19 is legally required to consider the environmental impact of those projects, say a collective of lawyers.

item.title: Spike in racism during pandemic, Human Rights Commission reports
item.description: As New Zealand makes strong progress in eliminating Covid-19, there are also calls to "flatten the racism curve".

item.title: Cabinet approves fast tracking of shovel ready projects
item.description: Cabinet has approved the fast tracking of large shovel ready projects, largely by-passing the Resource Management Act.

item.title: Union worried workers' voices not being heard in rest home review
item.description: A union says excluding rest home workers from a group investigating the aged residential care sector risks more deadly Covid-19 clusters emerging.

item.title: Person dead after Auckland house fire
item.description: One person has died following a house fire at a house north of Auckland last night.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ on 2 May
item.description: A resident of the Rosewood Rest Home in Christchurch - described as "a real Kiwi bloke" by his family - has died of Covid-19, increasing the country's total of deaths to 20.

item.title: Covid-19: goodbye to crowded offices, new work spaces in store post lockdown
item.description: As lockdowns are relaxed around the world and people return to their workplaces, the next challenge will be adapting office environments to the new normal.

item.title: Person dies after crash on SH27 near Thames
item.description: A person has died and two others have been seriously injured after a car crash in Hauraki District this afternoon.

item.title: Covid-19: Six new cases and further death reported for 2 May
item.description: There are six new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand and one further death today, while two clusters have also closed today.

item.title: New Zealand websites see visitor increase in lockdown
item.description: Traffic to New Zealand websites - including from outside the country - has spiked under lockdown, new data from InternetNZ reveals.

item.title: Wellington public transport may not meet level 2 demand
item.description: Trains and buses may not have the capacity to meet commuter demand and give space for 1-metre social distancing.

item.title: Girls blamed for spate of vehicle thefts in ManawatÅ«
item.description: Police are appealing for the public's help after a run of car thefts involving teenagers in Palmerston North and Feilding.

item.title: Covid-19: Updates from New Zealand and around the world on 2 May
item.description: A South Auckland charity is working to provide food, blankets, nappies and sanitary packs to the elderly, disabled, families and those with underlying health conditions.

item.title: Another 50 cargo flights a week, to and from New Zealand
item.description: Another 50 flights of air freight have been added each week to lift the volumes of goods going in and out of the country.

item.title: Lower THC limit needed under proposed cannabis regime - Drug Foundation
item.description: The NZ Drug Foundation has flagged some concern about the proposed THC limit for recreational cannabis under the proposed legal framework.

item.title: Bigger bubble with Australia, Asia, and Pacific mooted
item.description: A transtasman bubble could eventually be extended to include Asian and Pacific countries that have been successful in fighting Covid-19, epidemiologist Professor Michael Baker says.

item.title: Man missing from Porirua since March found dead
item.description: The body of a 49-year-old reported missing from Porirua in March has been found.

item.title: Hipkins announces $20m fund to help tertiary students to learn online
item.description: A $20 million fund has been announced to help tertiary students access digital devices and the internet to continue learning during Covid-19 disruptions.
